title.narrative: Mali Deployment of State Resources for Better Service Delivery & COVID-19 Response

description.narrative: The development objective of Deployment of State Resources for Better Service Delivery Project for Mali is to improve the availability and timeliness of resources from the central government to local governments (LGs), and service centers, as well as the management and accountability of these resources by LGs and service centers. This project has three components. 1) The first component, Supporting deployment to and management of resources to LGs, seeks to provide incentives to the government through disbursement-linked indicators (DLIs) to improve the availability, timeliness, and management of resources from the central government to LGs, all the way to service centers. 2) The second component, Strengthening institutions and capacity for more inclusive and accountable local governments, aims to support strengthening capacity at central and local levels to implement the decentralization framework through three interrelated sub-components. It has the following subcomponents: (i) Support to the implementation of the decentralization framework; (ii) Strengthening institutional capacity at local levels to better manage resources; and (iii) Strengthening oversight and citizen engagement mechanisms. 3) The third component, Project management, aims to support the day-to-day management of project activities, including consultant services, goods needed for the implementation and monitoring of project-related activities, and the evaluation of project outcomes.

condition.narrative: (Schedule 2 Section I.A) The Recipient shall, not later than forty-five (45) days after the Effective Date, establish the ProjectTechnical Steering Committee with a mandate, resources, terms of reference and functions satisfactory to the Association, andthereafter, maintain said Project Technical Steering Committee throughout Project implementation.

(Schedule 2 Section I.B) The Recipient shall carry out the Project in accordance with the provisions of the Project ImplementationManual, containing, inter alia, detailed arrangements and procedures for: (a) institutional coordination and day-to-day executionof the Project; (b) Project budgeting, disbursement and financial management; (c) procurement; (d) monitoring, evaluation,reporting and communication; (e) arrangements and procedures for the results framework, DLIs and verification protocols for suchDLIs; and (f) such other administrative, financial, technical and organizational arrangements and procedures as shall be requiredfor the Project.

(Schedule 2 Section I.D.1) The Recipient shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, recruit the IndependentVerification Agents, and thereafter, cooperate with said Independent Verification Agents, acting as third-party monitoring andevaluation experts to assess the proper fulfillment of DLIs as set forth in Schedule 3 to this Agreement.

1- The Recipient shall, not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, prepare, in accordance with terms of referenceacceptable to the Bank, a manual outlining detailed arrangements and procedures for the performance-based grant mechanism,including, inter alia, the minimum grant access eligibility criteria, arrangements and procedures for the results framework, PBC7and verification protocols for such PBC.

2- Not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, the Recipient's Minister in charge of local governments shall adopt adecision institutionalizing the Performance-Based Grant mechanism program and setting the minimum grant access eligibility criteriaand performance indicators and notify selected LGs of such decision;

title.narrative: Of which percentage of female elected officials trained
Of which percentage of female LG staff trained
The percentage of health infrastructures (CSCom) with an average score for the quality of facility (based on a checklist) of 70 percent in participating LGs
The percentage of public primary schools operational 30 days after the start of the school year in participating LGs
Execution of training plan for LG elected officials
Execution of training plan for LG staff
Reported grievances related to LG that are addressed in a timely manner
The number of communes with functional CDQs/Vs providing regular community feedback to LGs and/or DGCT
Communes that meet the conditions for access to performance-based grants in participating LGs
Time it takes for the payment of LG expenditures to service centers and other service providers
Time it takes to notify LGs of their budget allocation from the approval of the national budget
The percentage of central government budget tranferred to LGs
LG management accounts audited by the BVG annually
Female participation in CDQs/Vs in selected LGs
Submitted LG management accounts reviewed and judged by SC-CS
Number of operational municipal crisis monitoring units in participating LGs.
Number of hygiene kits delivered to participating LGs.
